question_text: What do you get if you add 1/8 to 1/8?
If you have 2/10 and subtract 1/10, what is left?
What is the total of 1/10 and 1/10?
What must be added to 3/12 to make 10/12?
If you take 6/11 from 8/11, what is left?
I ate 2/8 of a pizza, then I ate another 1/8. What fraction of the pizza did I eat in total?
A jug was 7/10 full of water. I poured out 3/10. What fraction of the jug is now full?
A painter paints 3/15 of a wall on Monday and 5/15 on Tuesday. What fraction of the wall has he painted?
A cake is cut into 10 slices. If 3/10 are eaten, what fraction is left?
From a pile of 9/9 of homework, you complete 4/9. How much is left?
A garden is 5/12 roses and 4/12 daisies. What fraction of the garden are these two flowers?
If a journey is 8/10 of a mile, and you have travelled 3/10, what fraction is left to travel?
A bottle is 9/10 full. You drink 2/10, then another 3/10. How full is the bottle now?
Jim reads 1/10 of a book, then 2/10, then 4/10. What fraction has he read?
A race is one whole lap. After 7/12 of the lap, how much is remaining?
A box contains red and blue balls. 3/10 are red. 6/10 are blue. What fraction are red or blue?
A tank has a capacity of 50 litres. It contains 17/50 litres. How much more is needed to make it 25/50 litres full?
From a full pie (8/8), you take away 2/8 and then 1/8. What fraction is left?
A path is 1 kilometre long. You walk 3/10 km then another 3/10 km. What fraction of the kilometre have you walked?
A pizza is cut into 8 slices. Tom eats 2/8 and Jane eats 3/8. What fraction of the pizza is left?
If I have 3/5 of a chocolate bar, what fraction do I need to eat to have 1/5 left?
Sam says that 3/10 + 4/10 = 7/20. Is he correct? Explain why.
A jug contains 9/10 of a litre of juice. If you pour out 3/10 and then another 4/10, how much is left?
What fraction must be added to 3/7 to make one whole?
A race is 12/12 laps. After 5/12 of the race, a car takes a pit stop. What fraction of the race is remaining after the stop?
What is the mistake in this calculation? 4/9 + 2/9 = 6/18
You need to paint a whole fence (15/15). You paint 6/15 on Saturday and 7/15 on Sunday. What fraction is left to paint?
I start with a whole piece of paper (1). I use 3/10 for a drawing and 4/10 for writing. What fraction is left?
A bag of sweets was 7/8 full. After eating some, it is now 2/8 full. What fraction of the bag was eaten?
A team needs 20/20 points to win. They have 11/20. How many more twentieths do they need?
A project is split into three parts. Part one is 2/10, part two is 3/10. What fraction is the third part?
A garden is 1/6 roses and 4/6 tulips. What fraction of the garden is not roses or tulips?
I have 5/9 of a pizza. How much more do I need to have a whole pizza?
A book has 100 pages. You read 25/100 and then 30/100. What fraction of the book is left to read?
A journey takes one hour. You travel for 15/60 of the hour, then rest for 10/60. What fraction of the hour is left?
Start with a whole (1). Subtract 3/8. What is left?
A task is 7/7 complete. If you did 2/7 yesterday and 3/7 today, what fraction must you do tomorrow?
Fill in the blank to make one whole: 1/9 + 4/9 + __ = 1.
A fuel tank was 11/12 full. After a trip it was 4/12 full. What fraction of the tank was used?
What do you get if you add 2/8 and 5/8?
If you have 4/5 and take away 2/5, what is left?
What is 3/5 + 4/5? Write your answer as a mixed number.
What is 7/8 + 5/8? Write your answer as a mixed number.
Calculate 2/3 + 2/3. Write your answer as a mixed number.
Find the sum of 5/6 and 3/6. Write your answer as a mixed number.
Solve: 4/7 + 5/7. Write your answer as a mixed number.
What is 9/10 + 3/10? Write your answer as a mixed number.
Calculate 5/9 + 5/9. Write your answer as a mixed number.
What is 11/12 + 3/12? Write your answer as a mixed number.
Find the sum of 3/4 and 3/4. Write your answer as a mixed number.
What is 7/11 + 6/11? Write your answer as a mixed number.
Calculate 8/9 + 4/9. Give your answer as a mixed number.
Solve: 6/10 + 7/10. Give your answer as a mixed number.
What is 10/11 + 5/11? Give your answer as a mixed number.
What is 7/12 + 7/12? Give your answer as a mixed number.
What is 5/6 + 5/6? Write your answer as a mixed number.
Solve: 3/4 + 2/4. Write your answer as a mixed number.
Calculate 4/5 + 3/5. Write your answer as a mixed number.
What is 6/8 + 6/8? Write your answer as a mixed number.
Find the sum of 8/12 and 9/12. Write your answer as a mixed number.
What is 5/7 + 4/7? Write the answer as a mixed number.
Calculate 8/11 + 8/11. Write the answer as a mixed number.
John ran 3/8 of a kilometre, then another 3/8. What total distance did he run? Simplify your answer.
What is 1/6 + 1/6? Write the answer in its simplest form.
A recipe needs 1/10 of a bag of flour for the cake and 3/10 for the pastry. What fraction is used in total? Simplify if you can.
What is 1/8 + 3/8 + 2/8? Give your answer in its simplest form.
A pizza is cut into 10 slices. You eat 2/10 and your friend eats 3/10. What fraction of the pizza did you eat together? Simplify the answer.
A jug was 7/8 full. If 1/8 was poured out, what fraction remains? Simplify if you can.
What is 5/12 + 5/12? Write as a mixed number in its simplest form.
A builder uses 3/4 of a bag of cement, then another 3/4. How much cement did he use? Write as a mixed number in simplest form.
Calculate 5/6 + 5/6. Write your answer as a mixed number, simplified.
A box of chocolates is 11/12 full. If 5/12 of the box is eaten, what fraction is left? Simplify.
What is 3/8 + 7/8? Give the answer as a simplified mixed number.
A run is 5/9 of a mile long. If you run it twice, what is the total distance? Give your answer as a mixed number.
Calculate 13/20 - 3/20. Write your answer in its simplest form.
A car travels 3/10 of a journey, then another 5/10. What fraction of the journey is complete? Simplify your answer.
Find the sum of 5/16, 1/16 and 2/16. Simplify the result.
What is 7/10 + 7/10? Give your answer as a simplified mixed number.
A task takes 50 minutes. You work for 15/50 of the time, then another 10/50. What fraction of the task have you done? Simplify.
A pizza has 12 slices. Sam eats 3/12 and Ann eats 4/12. What fraction of the pizza is left? Simplify your answer.
A jug was 7/8 full. I poured out 1/8 and then another 2/8. What fraction is now in the jug? Give your answer in its simplest form.
I started with a whole piece of ribbon. I cut off 3/10 and then another 3/10. What fraction of the ribbon is left? Simplify your answer.
A task requires 1 whole hour. I worked for 1/4 of an hour and then 1/4 of an hour. How much of the hour is left to work?
A painter says that 7/10 - 3/10 = 4/0. What is his mistake?
A bag of apples weighs one kilogram. I use 3/8 of the bag for a pie and 1/8 for a snack. What fraction of the bag is left?
I added a fraction to 3/9 and the answer was 7/9. What fraction did I add?
A fuel tank was full (1). After one journey it was 5/6 full. After a second journey it was 1/6 full. What fraction of the tank was used on the second journey?
I had 9/10 of a litre of juice. I drank some and now have 1/2 a litre. What fraction did I drink? (Hint: 1/2 = 5/10)
A project is 4/5 complete. What fraction is still left to do?
I started with 11/12 of a box of eggs. After making breakfast, I had 7/12 left. What fraction of the box did I use?
A box contains 5/6 of a dozen muffins. If 1/6 of a dozen are sold, what fraction of a dozen is left?
A journey is made of three parts. Part 1 is 3/10 of the total, Part 2 is 4/10. What fraction is Part 3?
I had a sum of money. I spent 1/5 on a book and 2/5 on a game. What fraction of my money is left?
What fraction do you need to subtract from 1 to get 3/7?
A garden is 5/12 grass and 3/12 flowers. What fraction of the garden is not grass or flowers? Simplify.
After adding 3/8 to a fraction, my answer was 1. What was the starting fraction?
I had 7/9 of a cake. I gave away some and was left with 1/3. What fraction did I give away? (Hint: 1/3 = 3/9)
A bottle of milk is 3/4 full. I use 1/4 for tea. What fraction is left?
I ate 1/10 of a pie, my brother ate 3/10, and my sister ate 2/10. What fraction of the pie is left?
I subtracted a fraction from 11/15 and the answer was 1/3. What fraction did I subtract? (Hint: 1/3 = 5/15)
A full glass of water is 1. If I drink 5/8 of it, what fraction remains?
A walk is 1km. You walk 2/5 km then stop. You then walk another 1/5 km. How much of the kilometre is left to walk?
What is 1/2 + 3/4? Write your answer as an improper fraction.
What is 5/6 + 1/3? Give your answer as a simplified improper fraction.
Calculate 3/5 + 7/10. Give your answer as an improper fraction.
What is 3/4 + 5/8? Write the answer as an improper fraction.
What is 2/3 + 5/6? Write the answer as an improper fraction.
Solve: 5/6 + 1/2. Give the answer as an improper fraction.
What is 3/4 + 1/2? Write the answer as an improper fraction.
Solve: 5/8 + 1/2. Write the answer as an improper fraction.
What is 4/5 + 1/2? Give the answer as an improper fraction.
Calculate 5/12 + 2/3. Give the answer as an improper fraction.
What is 3/4 + 3/8? Give the answer as an improper fraction.
What is 5/6 + 1/3? Give your answer as a mixed number.
What is 1/2 + 7/10? Give your answer as a mixed number.
Two friends shared a cake. One ate 1/2 and the other ate 1/4. What fraction did they eat altogether?
A recipe needs 1/3 of a cup of milk and 1/6 of a cup of water. What is the total amount of liquid?
What is 1/2 + 1/4 + 1/8? Give your answer as a fraction.
I ran 3/4 of a mile, then walked another 1/8 of a mile. How far did I go in total? Give your answer as an improper fraction.
A jug was 7/10 full. I used 1/5 of the full jug's capacity. What fraction is left?
Calculate 5/6 + 2/3. Give your answer as a simplified mixed number.
Solve: 4/5 + 1/2 + 1/10. Write the answer as a mixed number.
A farmer ploughed 1/3 of his field, then another 5/12. What fraction of the field has he ploughed in total?
A group of friends ate 1/2 of a pizza and then 3/8 of the same pizza. What fraction of the pizza did they eat?
Calculate 3/4 + 1/2 + 1/8. Write the answer as an improper fraction.
A painter uses 2/5 of a can of paint on a wall and 3/10 on a door. What fraction did he use altogether?
A book is read over three days. 1/4 is read on Monday, 3/8 on Tuesday. What fraction was read in the first two days?
A project is 7/9 complete. If an extra 1/3 is finished, what is the new total? Give your answer as a mixed number.
A cake recipe needs 3/4 cup of sugar and 1/8 cup of brown sugar. What is the total sugar needed?
A bottle is 4/5 full. 1/10 of the bottle's contents is used. What fraction of the bottle is now full?
A runner completes 1/2 of a race on Saturday and 1/4 on Sunday. What fraction of the race is complete?
I have 3/4 of a pizza. I eat 1/8. What fraction is left?
What is 1/2 + 1/6 + 1/3? Give your answer as one whole.
A full can of paint is used on a project. 1/2 is used for a wall, 1/4 for a door, and 1/8 for the trim. What fraction of the paint is left?
I started with a full glass of juice. I drank 1/3 of it. Then I refilled it by 1/6. What fraction of the glass is full now?
Tom calculated 3/4 + 1/8 as 4/12. Explain his mistake.
A garden is 1/5 roses and 3/10 daisies. The rest are tulips. What fraction are tulips?
I need 7/8 of a kg of flour. I have two bags, one with 1/2 kg and one with 1/4 kg. Do I have enough?
What is 1 minus the sum of 1/3 and 1/9?
A task is completed in 3 stages. Stage 1 takes 1/2 hour. Stage 2 takes 1/3 hour. The total time is 1 hour. What fraction of an hour does stage 3 take?
I had a full bottle of water. I drank 1/4, then my friend drank 1/8. What fraction is remaining?
I subtracted a fraction from 5/6 and the answer was 1/3. What fraction did I subtract?
A box was 7/10 full. I added items that filled another 1/5. Then I removed items that were 1/2 of the box's total volume. What fraction is it now?
A recipe needs 1/2 litre of milk, but I only have 1/3 of a litre. What fraction of a litre do I still need?
A farmer's land is 1/3 crops and 1/6 pasture. What fraction is something else?
After adding 3/8 to a fraction, the answer was 3/4. What was the starting fraction?
A team scores 1/2 of their points in the first half and 1/3 in the second half. What fraction of their points was scored at other times (e.g. overtime)?
Correct this calculation and explain the error: 5/8 - 1/4 = 4/4.
correct_answer: The answer is 3/8. The numerators were subtracted from each other but not the denominators.

question_text: A tank is 1/2 full. If I add water equal to 1/3 of the tank's capacity, what fraction of the tank will be full?
I have a pizza cut into 12 slices. I eat 1/4 of it. My friend eats 1/3 of it. How many slices are left?
From a piece of wood 7/8 m long, a piece 1/2 m long is cut. What is the length of the remaining wood?
What is the difference between 2/3 and 1/4?
Sam had a whole bar of chocolate. He ate 1/5 and gave 3/10 to his friend. What fraction did he have left?
A box is 1/4 full of red balls and 1/8 full of blue balls. The rest is empty. What fraction is empty?
Three friends ran a relay. The first ran 1 1/2 km, the second ran 3/4 km, and the third ran 1 1/4 km. What was the total distance?
A plank of wood was 3 1/4 metres long. A piece 1 1/3 metres long was cut off. How much is left?
A recipe needs 1 1/2 cups of flour, 3/4 cup of sugar, and 1/4 cup of cocoa. What is the total volume of dry ingredients?
A ribbon was 2 metres long. If you cut off 1/3 of a metre, how much is left?
A runner wants to complete 3 miles. She runs 1 1/2 miles and then 3/4 of a mile. How much further does she need to run?
A bucket contains 4 1/2 litres of water. If 1 3/4 litres leak out, how much is left?
I had 3 whole pizzas. My friends ate 1 3/8 pizzas. How much is left?
A trip has three stages. Stage one is 1/4 of the total distance, stage two is 2/5. What fraction is the third stage?
A film is 2 1/2 hours long. After 45 minutes (3/4 of an hour), how much time is left?
I start with a full 2-litre bottle of water. I drink 1/2 a litre, then 1/3 of a litre. How much is left?
A recipe requires 3 1/4 cups of flour. You have 1 1/2 cups. You find another bag with 2 1/3 cups. Do you have enough flour in total, and if so, how much will be left over?
What is the error in this calculation: 3 1/5 - 1 3/5 = 2 2/5? Explain and give the correct answer.
correct_answer: Cannot subtract 3/5 from 1/5 without regrouping. Answer is 1 3/5.

question_text: A runner plans to run 10 km. He runs 3 1/2 km and then rests. He then runs another 4 1/3 km. What fraction of the 10km is left to run?
Find the value of x if 2 1/2 + x = 4 1/4.
A tank has a capacity of 50 litres. It is 1/2 full. If 1/5 of the tank's capacity is added, and then 1/4 is removed, how many litres are in the tank?
I had a piece of string 5 1/4 metres long. I cut off 1 1/2 metres, then another 2 1/3 metres. How much string is left?
A project takes 20 hours. Team A works for 5 1/2 hours. Team B works for 8 1/4 hours. What fraction of the project is left to complete?
Let's check the previous question again. A project takes 20 hours. Team A works for 5 1/2 hours. Team B works for 8 1/4 hours. How many hours are left?
What is the sum of 3/4, 2/3 and 1/2? Subtract this sum from 2.
A full bucket weighs 10kg. The bucket itself weighs 1 1/4 kg. If the bucket is 1/2 full of water, what is the total weight?
Subtract 1 4/5 from the sum of 2 1/2 and 1 1/4.
A painter mixes 1 1/2 litres of red paint with 2 1/3 litres of white paint. He uses 3 litres of the mix. How much is left?
From a 5 metre roll of fabric, a tailor cuts 1 1/2 m and then 2 2/3 m. How much fabric remains on the roll?
Find the value of y: y - 1 3/4 = 2 1/2.
A container can hold 4 litres. It contains 1 1/2 litres. How much more is needed to make it 7/8 full?
A container holds 4 litres. It contains 1 1/2 litres. How much more is needed to make it 3/4 full?
A baker had 5kg of flour. He used 1 1/2 kg for bread and 2 1/4 kg for cakes. How much flour was left?
The sum of three fractions is 2. If two of the fractions are 1/2 and 2/3, what is the third fraction?
A journey from Town A to Town C goes through Town B. The distance from A to B is 5 1/2 miles. The distance from B to C is 4 4/5 miles. What is the total distance?
I started with a number and added 2 1/3. The result was 5. What number did I start with?
What is the perimeter of a rectangle with a length of 2 1/2 cm and a width of 1 1/4 cm?
A bag of potatoes weighs 2 1/2 kg. 3/4 kg are used. How many kg are left?
